page.title: 12DUDHOPE CASTLE, DUNDEE
page.content: {Dudhope Castle}was the home of the Scrymgeour family who lived there from the 14th century. They were the hereditary Constables of Dundee. By the 17th century, the castle was owned by the Graham family, the most famous of whom was{John Graham of {Claverhouse,}better known as{Bonnie {Dundee,}who was very popular with the people of Dundee. He was a staunch Roman Catholic and supported James VII against William of Orange. His death at{The Battle of Killiecrankie}ended Jacobite hopes in Scotland. After World War II, a small zoo was started; it was soon moved to bigger grounds in Camperdown Park, where it is still open to the public today. {Daniel Defoe}thought it a{"noble and {ancient pile"}over 250 years ago:now used as a storehouse, there is a proposal to restore and floodlight it.
